ManSection.Description: Returns The number of i-faces of M.
Returns the number of vertices of M.
Returns the number of edges of M.
Returns the number of facets of M.
Returns the number of ridges ((n-2)-faces) of M.
Returns the f-vector of M.
Returns the facet-types of M (i.e. the maniplexes corresponding to the facets). Currently only works for reflexible maniplexes.
Returns the types of vertex-figures of M (i.e. the maniplexes corresponding to the vertex-figures). Currently only works for reflexible maniplexes.
Given a list of lists of faces in increasing rank, where each face is described by the incident flags, gives you a IsPosetOfFlags object back.
Given a poset, returns the rank of the poset. Note: There may be hidden assumptions here to untangle later.

Given a group, returns a poset as a list of faces ordered by rank, where each face is represented as a list of the flags it contains. Note that this function does not include the minimal (empty) face nor the maximal face of the maniplex. Note that the i-faces correspond to the i+1 item in the list because of how GAP indexes lists.

Returns a full poset as a list of faces ordered by rank, where each face is represented as a list of the flags it contains. This function does include the minimal (empty) face nor the maximal face of the maniplex, so the list has n+2 ranks if the maniplex is of rank n. Note that the i-faces correspond to the i+1 item in the list because of how GAP indexes lists.

Given a maniplex, returns a poset as a list of faces ordered by rank, where each face is represented as a list of the flags it contains. Note that this function does not include the minimal (empty) face nor the maximal face of the maniplex. Note that the i-faces correspond to the i+1 item in the list because of how GAP indexes lists.

Given a maniplex, returns a poset as a list of faces ordered by rank, where each face is represented as a list of the flags it contains. Note that this function does include the minimal (empty) face and the maximal face of the maniplex. Note that the i-faces correspond to the i+1 item in the list because of how GAP indexes lists.
Given a poset, (not a fullposet) this will give you a version of the list of flags in terms of the faces described in the poset.

Given a flag (represented as chains of faces comprised of lists of flags) and a poset and a rank, this function will give you the i-adjacent flag. Note that adjacencies are listed from ranks 0 to one less than the dimension. You can replace flag with the integer corresponding to that flag.
Given a poset and an integer i, this function will give you the associated permutation for the rank i-connection.
Given a poset corresponding to a maniplex, this function will give you the connection group. Note that it assumes we are NOT using a full poset (currently).
Given a poset (whose elements are lists of flags) corresponding to a maniplex, this function will tell you if it is flaggable, i.e., if the flags can be recovered from the poset or not.
Given list, a poset as a list of faces ordered by rank, each face listing the flags on the face, this function will tell you if the poset is full or not.
